episodes.title: Jim Jones: The Disturbing Childhood of a Cult Leader | Before Jonestown (Part 1)
episodes.description:
In November of 1978, the world witnessed one of the most shocking tragedies in modern history — the Jonestown Massacre. But before Jim Jones became the infamous cult leader behind over 900 deaths in Guyana... he was just a boy from Indiana.

Who was Jim Jones before the Peoples Temple? What shaped him? And how does a kid obsessed with religion, death, and control eventually convince hundreds of people to follow him to their graves?

In this video, I’m diving deep into the childhood of Jim Jones — exploring his early life, family history, strange behavior, and the warning signs that were there long before Jonestown.

This is the beginning of a much bigger series I’m working on, unpacking the life, rise, and horrors of Jim Jones and the Peoples Temple. If you find true crime, cult psychology, and dark history fascinating — hit that like button, subscribe, and stick around.

Related Videos You Might Like:
→ The Bloody Island Massacre: https://youtu.be/1dVvdMaCDkI
→ Speed Freak Killers:https://youtu.be/w54FuXB4LSY

Sources & Recommended Reading:
The Road to Jonestown: Jim Jones and Peoples Temple — Jeff Guinn

Raven: The Untold Story of Rev. Jim Jones and His People by Tim Reiterman

Seductive Poison: A Jonestown Survivor's Story of Life and Death in the Peoples Temple — Deborah Layton

A Thousand Lives: The Untold Story of Hope, Deception, and Survival at Jonestown — Julia Scheeres

Suicide Cult: The Inside Story of the Peoples Temple Sect and the Massacre in Guyana  -- Marshall Kilduff & Ron Javers (1978)

http://jonestown.sdsu.edu/
